constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: MVKTC Name: Motor Vehicle Restricted Area (KTC)
KTCAAP Name: Kingston Town Centre AAP
KEYACH Name: Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change
CONARA Name: Kingston Old Town Conservation Area
KEYACO Name: Kingston Old Town Conservation Area

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT
LBCASE LB Address: 3&5CHURCH STREET (west side)KINGSTONLB Grade: GD2LB Ref: 6/15

decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.Reason: This is required by Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The proposed works pertaining to the removal of the upper floor shall not be carried out until documentation including detailed floor plans, section drawings and photographic evidence to clearly illustrate the location and number of historic timber joists which are to be removed at first floor level has been submitted and approved by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure that the special architectural and historic character of the Grade II Listed Building and Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No works shall be carried out to the first floor flooring until documentation including detailed floor plans, section plans and elevation drawings which clearly show what is to be retained after the part removal of the first floor flooring, and the proposed finish, has been submitted and approved by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure that the special architectural and historic character of the Grade II Listed Building and Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development hereby approved shall ensure the retention of all historic fabric and features, particularly historic doors, skirtings and floorboards where they appear shall be retained in present position and appropriately protected during the course of the works. Reason: To ensure that the special architectural and historic character of the Grade II Listed Building and Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the special architectural and historic character of the Grade II Listed Building and Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No investigations or repair works shall be carried out to the historic fabric and structure, until details of the location and method of any proposed investigations into the historic fabric and structure, and any subsequent repair works to take place, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the special architectural and historic character of the Grade II Listed Building and Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Unless otherwise stated on the approved drawings or other conditions, all new work or work of making good shall be executed in matching materials, method of construction and finished appearance.Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the Grade-II Listed Building in accordance with Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No works shall be carried out to the exterior of the rear elevation of the building, until samples of the proposed facing brickwork which shows brick type, size colour and pointing to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples. Reason: To ensure that the special architectural and historic character of the Grade II Listed Building and Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No services shall be installed, until details of the proposed mechanical, electrics and plumbing services strategy and associated builders works to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The services shall then be installed in accordance with the approved details. Reason: To ensure that the special architectural and historic character of the Grade II Listed Building and Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the special architectural and historic character of the Grade II Listed Building and Conservation Area is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
description: Internal and external alterations to building, including; partial removal of joists and floorboards at first floor, raising of ceiling height, removal of internal wall on the ground floor, and formation of opening on the first floor. The installation of a fully retractable projecting awning, signage, and the provision of external seating comprising 2no. benches associated with cafe use.
